Job Description:
Process Engineer – Renewable Products
Kern Oil & Refining Co. is an independent, family-owned, and operated refinery producing what we call “California Clean” transportation fuels. Tucked into a rural corner of Kern County, Kern Oil & Refining Co. has been operating continuously in the Central Valley since 1934.
Our team strives to anticipate and embrace the future of California Clean transportation fuels. Kern Oil & Refining Co. was just the second Refinery in the country to produce renewable diesel by co-processing bio-feed and the first small refiner in California to blend biodiesel. Kern Oil & Refining Co. is proud to do our part in California’s transition to clean-burning green fuels and reducing the state’s carbon footprint.

Job Posting Title:
Research Associate

-

Hiring Department:
Bureau of Economic Geology

-

Position Open To:
All Applicants

-


40

-


Exempt

-


Immediately

-


PICKLE RESEARCH CAMPUS

-


The ideal candidate will have a working knowledge or some familiarity with prominent workflows in data science and machine learning, data ETL (Extraction, Transformation and Loading), various commercial and open source fluid flow simulation packages (included but not limited to CMG, Eclipse, etc) and be able to contribute to the codes/algorithm development (Python) in a group of Engineers, Data Scientists, Geologist.

-


General Notes

This position is located at the J.J. Pickle Research Center in North Austin.

Responsibilities
Research and development in reservoir engineering and data science with focus on application to carbon capture, utilization and storage.
Fund raising from state, federal and industry to carry out fundamental and applied research in relevant topics.
Public outreach and communication of the results of the research including attending conferences and meetings.

Required Qualifications

MS plus 3 years’ experience or PhD plus 1 years' experience. Expertise in developing various machine learning models and neural networks. Familiarity with fluid flow modeling (CCUS). Ability to implement the practical application of advanced data & analytics methodologies (e. g., data mining, fuzzy logic, ANN s, AI, machine learning, statistics, etc.) to geoscience. Proven capacity for innovative, creative scientific analysis. Proven publication skills and verbal communication skills. Ability to work both independently and effectively in a group. Ability to work effectively with multiple disciplines, including engineers, data scientist, geologists.

Relevant education and experience may be substituted as appropriate.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in the application of various advanced data & analytics and statistical methodologies to large geophysical, petrophysical, geologic, reservoir and other subsurface data sets. Minimum 3 years of programming experience in Python. Minimum 3 years of experience using fluid flow simulation software. Proven publication record and verbal communication skills with a wide variety of audiences. 2-7 years’ experience, including hydrocarbon industry. Knowledge of Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS). Proven mentoring and program development track record. Broad skills base with deep expertise in certain areas, such as geomechanics, stratigraphy, 3D seismic interpretation, log analysis, and/or basin modelling. M.Sc./Ph.D. in a related major (petroleum engineering, computer sciences, electrical engineering, civil and environmental engineering, geophysics, etc).

Salary Range

$80,000 + depending on qualifications

Working Conditions

May work around standard office conditions

Repetitive use of a keyboard at a workstation

Occasional weekend, overtime and evening work to meet deadlines

Occasional intrastate, interstate and international travel

Field work as necessary

Required Materials

Resume/CV

3 work references with their contact information
Letter of interest

Description

The Instrument Engineer, Rodeo Refinery will be responsible for direct capital project execution, including project engineering, procurement and construction for projects ranging up to $5MM, with a particular focus on instrumentation/control systems projects. Ensures capital projects are technically sound, achieve safety and environmental objectives, and are consistent with PSM management of change.


Executing projects per the Phillips 66 and SFR project FEL process and ensures conformance with Phillips 66 Required Standards and Recommended Engineering Practices

Applying Phillips 66 Required Standards, engineering standards, mechanical integrity procedures, and safety procedures to address instrument reliability challenges.

Directing the development of AFD and AFE quality project estimates; participating in annual capital long range plan development, and ongoing project funding approvals.

Coordinating FEL and detailed engineering with mechanical, civil, instrument and electrical resources to ensure assigned projects are technically sound, cost effective and customer-focused

Developing project execution plans and project milestone schedules. Ensuring project scope and cost is controlled and change is managed. Projects include but not limited to instrumentation infrastructure improvement projects, increasing unit uptime, increasing product quality, and reducing refinery maintenance costs by developing and owning reliability improvement efforts for the plant’s instrumentation assets.

Providing project-specific turnaround and construction support as required.

Establishing project priorities, deliverables and deadlines aligned with capital strategies. Successfully managing competing priorities and multiple projects simultaneously. Accountable for managing time to deliver on commitments

Ensuring interface with technical consultants, area resources and Operations

Serves as instrumentation technical support for both Maintenance and Operations personnel, including but not limited to field instrument & process control troubleshooting support, training documentation & procedure development/review, and Management of Change (MOC) ownership.

Coordinating MOC process for assigned projects

Designing or approving design by others of Safety Instrumented Systems

Reviewing project design packages and providing design input to ensure that site requirements and preferences are met. After project commissioning, ensuring that newly installed instruments are captured on appropriate maintenance programs.

Providing consultation to refinery for instrumentation issues, including leading and participating in root cause failure analyses (RCFAs).


Legally authorized to work in the job posting country

Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or related field (Chemical or Civil)

5 or more years of instrumentation reliability and/or project engineering experience

The San Francisco Refinery consists of two facilities linked by a 200-mile pipeline. The Santa Maria facility is located in Arroyo Grande, California, 200 miles south of San Francisco, California, while the Rodeo facility is in the San Francisco Bay Area. Semi-refined liquid products from the Santa Maria facility are shipped by pipeline to the Rodeo facility for upgrading into finished petroleum products. Facilities include crude distillation, naphtha reforming, hydrocracking, hydrodesulfurization and delayed coking units, as well as a calciner. The San Francisco Refinery processes a mixture of heavy, high sulfur and light sweet crude oil. It receives California crude oil by pipeline, and both domestic and foreign crude oil by tanker. The refinery produces a high percentage of transportation fuels. It also produces CARB-grade gasoline. Other products include petroleum coke. The majority of the refined products are distributed to California by pipeline and barge. Additional refined products are also exported to Latin America by waterborne cargo.

Job Title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer I, PE
Job Description:
Senior Mechanical Design Engineer, PE Maryland Heights, MO System One is seeking a Senior Mechanical Design Engineer for an EPC firm in Maryland Heights, MO. The ideal candidate for the Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer position is expected to autonomously execute projects and lead a mechanical engineering team for larger project work. Project sectors served include petrochemical, refining, seed handling, pharmaceutical, consumer goods and food and beverage.

Senior Mechanical Design Engineer Responsibilities: Provide strong leadership to drive mechanical technical design and project coordination. Manage Project Schedules and Budgets as well as provide weekly reports to communicate project status, issues, and needs. Prepare equipment inquiry/RFQ packages Perform calculations in the field of heat/mass balance, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics. Meet with customers to understand project needs and develop service proposals.

Conduct and/or participate in pre-inspection / kickoff meetings with process equipment fabricators. Develop, review, and maintain project P&IDs. Under the general direction of the Supervisor of Operations Planning, the Distillate Planner forecasts, plans and coordinates the diesel blending operations of the Refinery units in a manner that optimizes Western Region profits while adhering to established Company guidelines, policies and safety rules. The Distillate Planner will own everything petroleum diesel related with joint ownership over renewable diesel, taking direction from the Renewables Planner.


Works closely with Commercial traders and schedulers to coordinate blending and shipping schedules to optimize operations and provide products to customer

Plan daily diesel blends for Operations

Ensure that finished diesel meets all State (CARB), Federal regulations and export specifications

Generate forecasts of diesel inventory

Control intermediate blendstock and finished diesel inventories

Works with Operations, Engineers, and Lab to execute blend schedule and minimize product spec giveaway

Track diesel blending metrics and records for internal and external reporting as required.

Works closely with Renewables Planner on matters related to renewable diesel

Analyze refinery operations and identify economic opportunities using a variety of tools/programs.

Work with Commercial to maximize refinery profitability

Determine breakeven values for stock purchases and product sales

Responsible for CARB notifications such tank service changes

Manage dock schedule

Backfill for other Planning department positions, as needed

Qualifications


Three years or more refining or other relevant industry experience

High School Diploma or GED equivalent

Able and willing to accept calls and work emergent issues during off-work hours

Legally authorized to work in the United States on a regular full-time basis without restrictions/sponsorship

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint

Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills

Ability to work independently

Demonstrated ability to learn a variety of new software tools (Pi Process Book, LabVantage, ORION)

The San Francisco Refinery consists of two facilities linked by a 200-mile pipeline. The Santa Maria facility is located in Arroyo Grande, California, 200 miles south of San Francisco, California, while the Rodeo facility is in the San Francisco Bay Area. Semi-refined liquid products from the Santa Maria facility are shipped by pipeline to the Rodeo facility for upgrading into finished petroleum products. Facilities include crude distillation, naphtha reforming, hydrocracking, hydrodesulfurization and delayed coking units, as well as a calciner. The San Francisco Refinery processes a mixture of heavy, high sulfur and light sweet crude oil. It receives California crude oil by pipeline, and both domestic and foreign crude oil by tanker. The refinery produces a high percentage of transportation fuels. It also produces CARB-grade gasoline. Other products include petroleum coke. The majority of the refined products are distributed to California by pipeline and barge. Additional refined products are also exported to Latin America by waterborne cargo.

Senior Mechanical Design Engineer Responsibilities: Provide strong leadership to drive mechanical technical design and project coordination. Manage Project Schedules and Budgets as well as provide weekly reports to communicate project status, issues, and needs. Prepare equipment inquiry/RFQ packages Perform calculations in the field of heat/mass balance, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics. Specify, review vendor bids, and perform vendor document review for various types of equipment such as pumps, compressors, heat exchangers, pressure vessels, and tanks. Select piping specification systems. Perform field surveys to collect required field data and assist with interpretation of engineering drawings and specifications in the field. Work with piping designers to optimize pipe routing on hot lines. Perform material selection evaluations specific to fluid properties, design life, and design corrosion allowance.

Prepare Mechanical Equipment, Tie-in, and Pipeline Schedules. Attend client, vendor, and internal team meetings and milestone project reviews. Perform site or shop related project inspections. Prepare engineering man-hour estimates for client proposals.

Participate in 3D model reviews during project stage-gates. The San Francisco Refinery consists of two facilities linked by a 200-mile pipeline. The Santa Maria facility is located in Arroyo Grande, California, 200 miles south of San Francisco, California, while the Rodeo facility is in the San Francisco Bay Area. Semi-refined liquid products from the Santa Maria facility are shipped by pipeline to the Rodeo facility for upgrading into finished petroleum products. Facilities include crude distillation, naphtha reforming, hydrocracking, hydrodesulfurization and delayed coking units, as well as a calciner. The San Francisco Refinery processes a mixture of heavy, high sulfur and light sweet crude oil. It receives California crude oil by pipeline, and both domestic and foreign crude oil by tanker. The refinery produces a high percentage of transportation fuels. It also produces CARB-grade gasoline. Other products include petroleum coke. The majority of the refined products are distributed to California by pipeline and barge. Additional refined products are also exported to Latin America by waterborne cargo.

Job Title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer I, PE
Job Description:
Senior Mechanical Design Engineer, PE Maryland Heights, MO System One is seeking a Senior Mechanical Design Engineer for an EPC firm in Maryland Heights, MO. The ideal candidate for the Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer position is expected to autonomously execute projects and lead a mechanical engineering team for larger project work. Project sectors served include petrochemical, refining, seed handling, pharmaceutical, consumer goods and food and beverage.

Senior Mechanical Design Engineer Responsibilities: Provide strong leadership to drive mechanical technical design and project coordination. Manage Project Schedules and Budgets as well as provide weekly reports to communicate project status, issues, and needs. Prepare equipment inquiry/RFQ packages Perform calculations in the field of heat/mass balance, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics. Meet with customers to understand project needs and develop service proposals.

Specify, review vendor bids, and perform vendor document review for various types of equipment such as pumps, compressors, heat exchangers, pressure vessels, and tanks. Conduct and/or participate in pre-inspection / kickoff meetings with process equipment fabricators. Develop, review, and maintain project P&IDs. Participate in plant and system layout and elevation studies.

Select piping specification systems. Perform field surveys to collect required field data and assist with interpretation of engineering drawings and specifications in the field. Work with piping designers to optimize pipe routing on hot lines. Perform material selection evaluations specific to fluid properties, design life, and design corrosion allowance.

Prepare Mechanical Equipment, Tie-in, and Pipeline Schedules. Attend client, vendor, and internal team meetings and milestone project reviews. Perform site or shop related project inspections. Prepare engineering man-hour estimates for client proposals.

Participate in 3D model reviews during project stage-gates. Senior Mechanical Design Engineer Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering 10 - 15 years related work experience in Process Plant, Petroleum Refining, and / or Petrochemical sector. PE license Experience in project development applying standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria to size/select equipment and ensure compliance with safety and environmental regulations. Solid background in pump/piping hydraulic evaluations rather from experience or course work.

Experience in sizing and rating pumps, vessels, and exchangers from experience of course work Experience in PFD and P&ID development. Project Canary is a growth-stage, SaaS and certification company combatting climate change from an incredible vantage point that can impact oil & gas, utilities, landfills, and ag. We are a Public Benefit Corp (B-Corp rating score 107) that helps monitor and mitigate emissions in the ESG landscape favored by communities and investors alike through independent data tied to carbon and environmental footprints. With flexible work environments in Denver,
Project Canary's mission is to make net-zero a reality by quantifying climate change and putting actionable insights into the hands of the energy sector. Our diverse and inclusive team of operators, scientists, engineers, and sales leaders know how to network, hustle, and are change-makers by design. We ingest data from various sources, including our own proprietary environmental sensors/hardware, to calculate carbon emissions from different facilities in real-time displayed on a SaaS dashboard. The resulting independent trusted data can inform the procurement of offsets in real-time using micro-transactions, formulate a data-driven ESG strategy that investors now demand, improve operations by identifying problem areas in minutes, and bolster customer engagement through radical supply chain transparency.

About KTC Instruments and the Mechanical Engineering Position.
KTC Instruments is comprised of three companies. King Tester Corporation, Tensitron, and Cianflone Scientific.
King Tester Corporation : We are one of the industry leaders in portable Brinell hardness testers, Rockwell testers, test blocks and microscopes. Our customers include some of the largest names in aerospace, rail, auto, foundries, steel and aluminum mills, calibration labs, oil and gas, heat treaters, wear parts, military, infrastructure, construction and utilities.
Tensitron is a KTC Instruments Company, founded in 1935, which designs, manufactures, sells, and services digital, mechanical and electronic tension measuring instrumentation. Its products are used in many different industries and companies for a variety of quality control purposes. We are recognized as the leading provider of superior precision tension meters and tension measuring instrumentation used world-wide in manufacturing and test facilities.

Our technology greatly increases secondary and tertiary oil production from existing wells. The salary is competitive, with unlimited career advancement potential.

The Position: You will be trained in our technology and be part of a crack global team of well and reservoir experts. You will be involved in picking appropriate wells, overseeing tests, conducting equipment installation, monitoring production from a control center in Houston, working remotely with operators, and traveling on immediate notice to solve major issues if necessary. You will take the initiative to maintain good relations at the operations and management level with clients. You will coordinate and share opinions with a control center in Bogota and other regional centers that will be established as we continue to roll out. Travel will be in the US and to other countries.

The Instrument Engineer, Rodeo Refinery will be responsible for direct capital project execution, including project engineering, procurement and construction for projects ranging up to $5MM, with a particular focus on instrumentation/control systems projects. Ensures capital projects are technically sound, achieve safety and environmental objectives, and are consistent with PSM management of change.


Executing projects per the Phillips 66 and SFR project FEL process and ensures conformance with Phillips 66 Required Standards and Recommended Engineering Practices

Applying Phillips 66 Required Standards, engineering standards, mechanical integrity procedures, and safety procedures to address instrument reliability challenges.

Directing the development of AFD and AFE quality project estimates; participating in annual capital long range plan development, and ongoing project funding approvals.

Coordinating FEL and detailed engineering with mechanical, civil, instrument and electrical resources to ensure assigned projects are technically sound, cost effective and customer-focused

Developing project execution plans and project milestone schedules. Ensuring project scope and cost is controlled and change is managed. Projects include but not limited to instrumentation infrastructure improvement projects, increasing unit uptime, increasing product quality, and reducing refinery maintenance costs by developing and owning reliability improvement efforts for the plant’s instrumentation assets.

Providing project-specific turnaround and construction support as required.

Establishing project priorities, deliverables and deadlines aligned with capital strategies. Successfully managing competing priorities and multiple projects simultaneously. Accountable for managing time to deliver on commitments

Ensuring interface with technical consultants, area resources and Operations

Serves as instrumentation technical support for both Maintenance and Operations personnel, including but not limited to field instrument & process control troubleshooting support, training documentation & procedure development/review, and Management of Change (MOC) ownership.

Coordinating MOC process for assigned projects

Designing or approving design by others of Safety Instrumented Systems

Reviewing project design packages and providing design input to ensure that site requirements and preferences are met. After project commissioning, ensuring that newly installed instruments are captured on appropriate maintenance programs.

Providing consultation to refinery for instrumentation issues, including leading and participating in root cause failure analyses (RCFAs).

The San Francisco Refinery consists of two facilities linked by a 200-mile pipeline. The Santa Maria facility is located in Arroyo Grande, California, 200 miles south of San Francisco, California, while the Rodeo facility is in the San Francisco Bay Area. Semi-refined liquid products from the Santa Maria facility are shipped by pipeline to the Rodeo facility for upgrading into finished petroleum products. Facilities include crude distillation, naphtha reforming, hydrocracking, hydrodesulfurization and delayed coking units, as well as a calciner. The San Francisco Refinery processes a mixture of heavy, high sulfur and light sweet crude oil. It receives California crude oil by pipeline, and both domestic and foreign crude oil by tanker. The refinery produces a high percentage of transportation fuels. It also produces CARB-grade gasoline. Other products include petroleum coke. The majority of the refined products are distributed to California by pipeline and barge. Additional refined products are also exported to Latin America by waterborne cargo.

The San Francisco Refinery consists of two facilities linked by a 200-mile pipeline. The Santa Maria facility is located in Arroyo Grande, California, 200 miles south of San Francisco, California, while the Rodeo facility is in the San Francisco Bay Area. Semi-refined liquid products from the Santa Maria facility are shipped by pipeline to the Rodeo facility for upgrading into finished petroleum products. Facilities include crude distillation, naphtha reforming, hydrocracking, hydrodesulfurization and delayed coking units, as well as a calciner. The San Francisco Refinery processes a mixture of heavy, high sulfur and light sweet crude oil. It receives California crude oil by pipeline, and both domestic and foreign crude oil by tanker. The refinery produces a high percentage of transportation fuels. It also produces CARB-grade gasoline. Other products include petroleum coke. The majority of the refined products are distributed to California by pipeline and barge. Additional refined products are also exported to Latin America by waterborne cargo.

The Instrument Engineer, Rodeo Refinery will be responsible for direct capital project execution, including project engineering, procurement and construction for projects ranging up to $5MM, with a particular focus on instrumentation/control systems projects. Ensures capital projects are technically sound, achieve safety and environmental objectives, and are consistent with PSM management of change.


Executing projects per the Phillips 66 and SFR project FEL process and ensures conformance with Phillips 66 Required Standards and Recommended Engineering Practices

Applying Phillips 66 Required Standards, engineering standards, mechanical integrity procedures, and safety procedures to address instrument reliability challenges.

Directing the development of AFD and AFE quality project estimates; participating in annual capital long range plan development, and ongoing project funding approvals.

Coordinating FEL and detailed engineering with mechanical, civil, instrument and electrical resources to ensure assigned projects are technically sound, cost effective and customer-focused

Developing project execution plans and project milestone schedules. Ensuring project scope and cost is controlled and change is managed. Projects include but not limited to instrumentation infrastructure improvement projects, increasing unit uptime, increasing product quality, and reducing refinery maintenance costs by developing and owning reliability improvement efforts for the plant’s instrumentation assets.

Providing project-specific turnaround and construction support as required.

Establishing project priorities, deliverables and deadlines aligned with capital strategies. Successfully managing competing priorities and multiple projects simultaneously. Accountable for managing time to deliver on commitments

Ensuring interface with technical consultants, area resources and Operations

Serves as instrumentation technical support for both Maintenance and Operations personnel, including but not limited to field instrument & process control troubleshooting support, training documentation & procedure development/review, and Management of Change (MOC) ownership.

Coordinating MOC process for assigned projects

Designing or approving design by others of Safety Instrumented Systems

Reviewing project design packages and providing design input to ensure that site requirements and preferences are met. After project commissioning, ensuring that newly installed instruments are captured on appropriate maintenance programs.

Providing consultation to refinery for instrumentation issues, including leading and participating in root cause failure analyses (RCFAs).

The San Francisco Refinery consists of two facilities linked by a 200-mile pipeline. The Santa Maria facility is located in Arroyo Grande, California, 200 miles south of San Francisco, California, while the Rodeo facility is in the San Francisco Bay Area. Semi-refined liquid products from the Santa Maria facility are shipped by pipeline to the Rodeo facility for upgrading into finished petroleum products. Facilities include crude distillation, naphtha reforming, hydrocracking, hydrodesulfurization and delayed coking units, as well as a calciner. The San Francisco Refinery processes a mixture of heavy, high sulfur and light sweet crude oil. It receives California crude oil by pipeline, and both domestic and foreign crude oil by tanker. The refinery produces a high percentage of transportation fuels. It also produces CARB-grade gasoline. Other products include petroleum coke. The majority of the refined products are distributed to California by pipeline and barge. Additional refined products are also exported to Latin America by waterborne cargo.

Introduction
Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. Who are we? Watch to find out! Do you have a long-term vision for your career? Is it time that you join a company that aligns with your values and beliefs? At Flint Hills, 90% of our earnings are reinvested in the company so that we can create opportunities and long-term value for our customers, employees, and society. Our culture is defined by the Market-Based Management (MBM)® philosophy which guides everyday decision making and provides employees with opportunities to contribute and personally benefit from the value they create. We are looking for an experienced Fixed Equipment Reliability Engineer for our Corpus Christi Refinery.
9/80 Schedule
What You Will Do In Your Role

We are offering a job opportunity in Midland area to help build a high growth new oil field service company that employs a proprietary digital technology. Our technology greatly increases secondary and tertiary oil production from existing wells. The salary is competitive, with unlimited career advancement potential.
The Company: Oleum Technology has offices in New York and Houston, and field operations in Colombia and Mexico. We are now expanding our operations into the US and other parts of the world. We also are adding related technologies.
The Position: You will be trained in our technology and be part of a crack global team of well and reservoir experts. You will be involved in picking appropriate wells, overseeing tests, conducting equipment installation, monitoring production from a control center in Houston, working remotely with operators, and traveling on immediate notice to solve major issues if necessary. You will take the initiative to maintain good relations at the operations and management level with clients. You will coordinate and share opinions with a control center in Bogota and other regional centers that will be established as we continue to roll out. Travel will be in the US and to other countries.

Company Overview:
If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you’re searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. As an individual contributor, or as a leader of people, your enterprise mindset will ensure Flowserve’s position as the global standard in comprehensive flow control solutions. Here, your opportunity for professional development and industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!
Role Summary:
The Application Engineer sees it all—design, manufacturing, installation and operation of our pumps and seals at our customers’ sites in the oil and chemical industries. In this challenging position the Application Engineer (AE) provides real-time technical support to our customers, and provides recommendations for repairs, upgrades, and replacement equipment. The AE is actively engaged in troubleshooting problems and implementing solutions onsite at nearby customer facilities.

Our client is a major refinery in the Los Angeles area serving the fuel transportation and aviation fuel needs of the western United States. Operates an integrated network of strategic assets that creates and sells refined petroleum products, from feedstock acquisition to wholesale, commercial and retail sales outlets. They are looking for a Mechanical Integrity Engineer who has fixed equipment experience to support their refinery in the South Bay.
Summary:

The Mechanical Integrity Engineer helps ensure reliable mechanical integrity of fixed equipment and piping with the prevention of leaks, failures, and process safety events. Activities include monitoring and responding to refinery operational conditions, implementing and supporting Mechanical Integrity Department initiatives, and providing technical input for Maintenance and Project Engineering objectives.

Battelle delivers when others can’t. We conduct research and development, manage national laboratories, design and manufacture products and deliver critical services for our clients—whether they are a multi-national corporation, a small start-up or a government agency.

We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.

JOB SUMMARY
Our Energy group in the Environment & Infrastructure Business Unit specializes in providing innovative approaches to solving difficult problems in the areas of oil and gas exploration and production and using or storing carbon dioxide generated during energy production and use. We use advanced earth science tools, methods, and models to characterize geologic systems for the oil and gas industry and for long term storage of CO2, including enhanced hydrocarbon recovery. Our clients include large and small oil and gas companies, engineering companies, electric utilities, and federal and state governments.

You may not realize it, but you’ve likely used a product today made possible by the plastics and chemicals manufactured by Chevron Phillips Chemical. From medical supplies and electronics to food packaging and cosmetics, we create the building blocks for more than 70,000 consumer and industrial products.

Even as a global company with 5,000 employees, we maintain a “small company feel” and uphold a culture of respect, diversity, and inclusion. Ask any Chevron Phillips Chemical employee what they like best about their job, and universally, the answer is “the people I work with!” We value work-life balance, and love to see our employees thrive both professionally and personally. There has never been a better time to work for Chevron Phillips Chemical. If you’re ready to grow with us and become part of our vision of being the premier Chemical Company, apply today!

Job Title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer I, PE
Job Description:
Senior Mechanical Design Engineer, PE Maryland Heights, MO System One is seeking a Senior Mechanical Design Engineer for an EPC firm in Maryland Heights, MO. The ideal candidate for the Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer position is expected to autonomously execute projects and lead a mechanical engineering team for larger project work. Project sectors served include petrochemical, refining, seed handling, pharmaceutical, consumer goods and food and beverage.

Senior Mechanical Design Engineer Responsibilities: Provide strong leadership to drive mechanical technical design and project coordination. Manage Project Schedules and Budgets as well as provide weekly reports to communicate project status, issues, and needs. Prepare equipment inquiry/RFQ packages Perform calculations in the field of heat/mass balance, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics. Meet with customers to understand project needs and develop service proposals.

Specify, review vendor bids, and perform vendor document review for various types of equipment such as pumps, compressors, heat exchangers, pressure vessels, and tanks. Conduct and/or participate in pre-inspection / kickoff meetings with process equipment fabricators. Develop, review, and maintain project P&IDs. Job Title: Technical Pre-Sales Engineer - IBM System Z
Job Description:
Introduction
Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a CTP you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities
Technical Sales Specialist for the Industrial Market to team with IBM System z software to support the 5 industries of the market (Automotive, Chemicals and Petroleum, Electronics, Aerospace, and Industrial Products). The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in System z software, demonstrating a high level of expertise in IBM System z. In addition to a technical foundation, the Technical Sales Specialist will require excellent consultative, project management and solution sales skills to foster relationships with clients, IBM Partners, resident and cross-functional peers in order to execute sales objectives and targets.

Location Preference: Any where in US

Summary:
Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is searching for a contract Reservoir Engineer for operated assets in the Delaware Basin; this position will report directly to the VP of Engineering.
Company:
Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is an independent oil and natural gas company headquartered in downtown Houston, TX. In partnership with a leading private equity financial sponsor, Carnelian Energy Capital, Percussion pursues an acquisition and exploitation strategy in select onshore basins in North America with existing operations in in the Delaware Basin.Percussion Petroleum I, LLC was formed in January 2016 with an equity commitment from Carnelian Energy Capital’s first fund. Percussion built a 22,000 net acre position in Eddy & Lea County, New Mexico with 220 operated wells that produced 9000 net boepd, which was sold in June 2019.

What You Will Do In Your Role

About KTC Instruments and the Mechanical Engineering Position.
KTC Instruments is comprised of three companies. King Tester Corporation, Tensitron, and Cianflone Scientific.
King Tester Corporation : We are one of the industry leaders in portable Brinell hardness testers, Rockwell testers, test blocks and microscopes. Our customers include some of the largest names in aerospace, rail, auto, foundries, steel and aluminum mills, calibration labs, oil and gas, heat treaters, wear parts, military, infrastructure, construction and utilities.
Tensitron is a KTC Instruments Company, founded in 1935, which designs, manufactures, sells, and services digital, mechanical and electronic tension measuring instrumentation. Its products are used in many different industries and companies for a variety of quality control purposes. We are recognized as the leading provider of superior precision tension meters and tension measuring instrumentation used world-wide in manufacturing and test facilities.

We are offering a job opportunity in Midland area to help build a high growth new oil field service company that employs a proprietary digital technology. Our technology greatly increases secondary and tertiary oil production from existing wells. The salary is competitive, with unlimited career advancement potential.
The Company: Oleum Technology has offices in New York and Houston, and field operations in Colombia and Mexico. We are now expanding our operations into the US and other parts of the world. We also are adding related technologies.
The Position: You will be trained in our technology and be part of a crack global team of well and reservoir experts. You will be involved in picking appropriate wells, overseeing tests, conducting equipment installation, monitoring production from a control center in Houston, working remotely with operators, and traveling on immediate notice to solve major issues if necessary. You will take the initiative to maintain good relations at the operations and management level with clients. You will coordinate and share opinions with a control center in Bogota and other regional centers that will be established as we continue to roll out. Travel will be in the US and to other countries.

Our Energy group in the Environment & Infrastructure Business Unit specializes in providing innovative approaches to solving difficult problems in the areas of oil and gas exploration and production and using or storing carbon dioxide generated during energy production and use. Evaluate information and make recommendations regarding viability.

Pipe Stress Engineer Maryland Heights, MO System One is seeking a Pipe Stress Engineer will be responsible for performing pipe stress analysis per applicable ASME codes and standards; utilize pipe stress software; evaluate calculated stress results, displacements, and pipe support loads; and design and select supports, spring hangers, flexible hose, and expansion joints for piping systems as well as preparation of technical datasheets. Pipe Stress Engineer Responsibilities: Responsible for completing project specific objectives on time Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, schematics, or computer-generated reports Provide direct support to staff engineers in planning, design, analysis, manufacturing, and assembly in a hands-on capacity Conduct and participate in design reviews and various engineering related meetings Develop, execute, and document test procedures and results Gather, analyze, and document data concerning existing equipment and provide data comparisons Develop 3D models for rapid prototyping Complete project documentation as required by the engineering quality management process Assist with the development of the equipment analytics scheme Conduct research that tests or analyzes the feasibility, design, operation, or performance of equipment, components, or systems Develop and test models of alternate designs and processing methods to assess feasibility, operating condition effects, possible new applications and necessity of modification Specify system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications Develop, coordinate, or monitor all aspects of production, including selection of manufacturing methods, fabrication, or operation of product designs Independently evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria using judgment in making minor adaptations and modifications Present technical information to peers or other personnel for review, to implement operating procedures, and resolve system malfunctions Recommend design modifications to eliminate machine or system malfunctions Pipe Stress Engineer Requirements: Bachelors Degree in a mechanical, industrial, chemical or petroleum engineering discipline from an accredited engineering program 6-8 years of background in one or more of the following industries: Energy and Chemicals, Power, Food and Beverage, Pharma and Biotech, Manufacturing 6-8 years of experience with pipe stress analysis, CAESAR II, NozzlePro, manual valve list, stress list, line list, specialty items list, requisition development Pipe stress analysis experience with Hot and Cold (Cryo) lines, etc Knowledge of ASME B31.3 code, API codes All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. Project Manager Maryland Heights, MO System One is seeking a Project Manager to support a project management department in Maryland Heights, MO. Projects will include process plants, petroleum refining, and / or petrochemical chemical plants, food and beverage plants, and refinery plants. Project Manager Responsibilities: Support the Senior Project Manager with the execution of all aspects of the project including managing the staff, providing vision and strategic leadership, monitoring project schedules and budgets, evaluating project productivity and quality and directing the complete technical operations of the project. Direct and manage the activities of Project Engineers, Project Assistants and support personnel in the planning, scheduling, design quality and execution of projects.

Assume full responsibility for the successful execution of each assigned project for schedule compliance, budget compliance, and scope and quality of deliverables. Build relationships and coordinate with the client and project personnel. Ensure the client's input and job requirements are adequately addressed and implemented consistently within the contractual requirements. Organize and supervise the implementation of project management systems and corporate quality systems.

Maintain a documentation file, accurately describing all commercial, technical and financial correspondence. Prepare and evaluate monthly progress reports; describing the schedule, manpower expenditures and work scope for accuracy, completeness and timeliness. Ensure invoices are processed timely and accurately. Act as a liaison between the client and the accounting department on outstanding invoices over 90 days old.

Identify and document that engineering change orders are being processed in a timely fashion where additional work is identified beyond original scope. Develop new business opportunities as a by-product of relationship with clients. Participate in business development meetings. Plan and identify upcoming tasks, potential problem areas, technical information, staffing priorities and identify solutions where necessary.

Responsible to maintain proper staff levels to meet project requirements. Actively recruit and train personnel for project as necessary. Develop, coach and track employee skill level in technical and work management areas. Develops project proposals, proposal scopes of work, and budgets.

Develop and present Project Reports for clients. Principal client contact for major accounts and manage multiple customers simultaneously. Performs field walk downs and data collection. Position necessitates field activities, some climbing, and occasional travel Project Manager Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering 5-15 years of experience in the Process Plant, Petroleum Refining, and / or Petrochemical Sector Experience applying standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria to ensure compliance with safety and environmental regulations Additional Information: All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.

Salary will be commensurate with experience. System One maintains a drug-free workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Technical Pre-Sales Engineer - IBM System Z
Job Description:
Introduction
Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a CTP you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities
Technical Sales Specialist for the Industrial Market to team with IBM System z software to support the 5 industries of the market (Automotive, Chemicals and Petroleum, Electronics, Aerospace, and Industrial Products). The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in System z software, demonstrating a high level of expertise in IBM System z. In addition to a technical foundation, the Technical Sales Specialist will require excellent consultative, project management and solution sales skills to foster relationships with clients, IBM Partners, resident and cross-functional peers in order to execute sales objectives and targets.

Location Preference: Any where in US

Summary:
Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is searching for a contract Reservoir Engineer for operated assets in the Delaware Basin; this position will report directly to the VP of Engineering.
Company:
Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is an independent oil and natural gas company headquartered in downtown Houston, TX. In partnership with a leading private equity financial sponsor, Carnelian Energy Capital, Percussion pursues an acquisition and exploitation strategy in select onshore basins in North America with existing operations in in the Delaware Basin.Percussion Petroleum I, LLC was formed in January 2016 with an equity commitment from Carnelian Energy Capital’s first fund. Percussion built a 22,000 net acre position in Eddy & Lea County, New Mexico with 220 operated wells that produced 9000 net boepd, which was sold in June 2019.

We are offering a job opportunity in Midland area to help build a high growth new oil field service company that employs a proprietary digital technology. Our technology greatly increases secondary and tertiary oil production from existing wells. The salary is competitive, with unlimited career advancement potential.
The Company: Oleum Technology has offices in New York and Houston, and field operations in Colombia and Mexico. We are now expanding our operations into the US and other parts of the world. We also are adding related technologies.
The Position: You will be trained in our technology and be part of a crack global team of well and reservoir experts. You will be involved in picking appropriate wells, overseeing tests, conducting equipment installation, monitoring production from a control center in Houston, working remotely with operators, and traveling on immediate notice to solve major issues if necessary. You will take the initiative to maintain good relations at the operations and management level with clients. You will coordinate and share opinions with a control center in Bogota and other regional centers that will be established as we continue to roll out. Travel will be in the US and to other countries.

The Application Engineer sees it all—design, manufacturing, installation and operation of our pumps and seals at our customers’ sites in the oil and chemical industries. The AE is actively engaged in troubleshooting problems and implementing solutions onsite at nearby customer facilities.

He/she will apply his/her experience in: HVAC, plumbing/piping and fire protection systems. As part of a multi-disciplined firm, he/she will be coordinating with Site/Civil Engineers, Electrical Engineers, Structural Engineers, Architects and Construction Project Managers. He/she will be responsible for the production of mechanical engineering construction documents while adhering to client requirements, code requirements and site adjustments.
Essential Duties:
Conduct site visit investigations and generate reports and recommendations based on findings.

Our client is a major refinery in the Los Angeles area serving the fuel transportation and aviation fuel needs of the western United States. Summary:

The Mechanical Integrity Engineer helps ensure reliable mechanical integrity of fixed equipment and piping with the prevention of leaks, failures, and process safety events. Activities include monitoring and responding to refinery operational conditions, implementing and supporting Mechanical Integrity Department initiatives, and providing technical input for Maintenance and Project Engineering objectives.

JOB SUMMARY
Our Energy group in the Environment & Infrastructure Business Unit specializes in providing innovative approaches to solving difficult problems in the areas of oil and gas exploration and production and using or storing carbon dioxide generated during energy production and use. We use advanced earth science tools, methods, and models to characterize geologic systems for the oil and gas industry and for long term storage of CO2, including enhanced hydrocarbon recovery. Our clients include large and small oil and gas companies, engineering companies, electric utilities, and federal and state governments.

Pipe Stress Engineer Maryland Heights, MO System One is seeking a Pipe Stress Engineer will be responsible for performing pipe stress analysis per applicable ASME codes and standards; utilize pipe stress software; evaluate calculated stress results, displacements, and pipe support loads; and design and select supports, spring hangers, flexible hose, and expansion joints for piping systems as well as preparation of technical datasheets. Pipe Stress Engineer Responsibilities: Responsible for completing project specific objectives on time Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, schematics, or computer-generated reports Provide direct support to staff engineers in planning, design, analysis, manufacturing, and assembly in a hands-on capacity Conduct and participate in design reviews and various engineering related meetings Develop, execute, and document test procedures and results Gather, analyze, and document data concerning existing equipment and provide data comparisons Develop 3D models for rapid prototyping Complete project documentation as required by the engineering quality management process Assist with the development of the equipment analytics scheme Conduct research that tests or analyzes the feasibility, design, operation, or performance of equipment, components, or systems Develop and test models of alternate designs and processing methods to assess feasibility, operating condition effects, possible new applications and necessity of modification Specify system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications Develop, coordinate, or monitor all aspects of production, including selection of manufacturing methods, fabrication, or operation of product designs Independently evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria using judgment in making minor adaptations and modifications Present technical information to peers or other personnel for review, to implement operating procedures, and resolve system malfunctions Recommend design modifications to eliminate machine or system malfunctions Pipe Stress Engineer Requirements: Bachelors Degree in a mechanical, industrial, chemical or petroleum engineering discipline from an accredited engineering program 6-8 years of background in one or more of the following industries: Energy and Chemicals, Power, Food and Beverage, Pharma and Biotech, Manufacturing 6-8 years of experience with pipe stress analysis, CAESAR II, NozzlePro, manual valve list, stress list, line list, specialty items list, requisition development Pipe stress analysis experience with Hot and Cold (Cryo) lines, etc Knowledge of ASME B31.3 code, API codes All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. Salary will be commensurate with experience. System One maintains a drug-free workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

TAMPA TANK, INC. – FLORIDA STRUCTURAL STEEL
With 60+ years in business, TTI-FSS is recognized domestically and internationally as being a certified and qualified shop specializing in fast-track, on time, on-budget, high-quality engineering, design, fabrication and construction. Project Manager Maryland Heights, MO System One is seeking a Project Manager to support a project management department in Maryland Heights, MO. Projects will include process plants, petroleum refining, and / or petrochemical chemical plants, food and beverage plants, and refinery plants. Project Manager Responsibilities: Support the Senior Project Manager with the execution of all aspects of the project including managing the staff, providing vision and strategic leadership, monitoring project schedules and budgets, evaluating project productivity and quality and directing the complete technical operations of the project. Direct and manage the activities of Project Engineers, Project Assistants and support personnel in the planning, scheduling, design quality and execution of projects.

Assume full responsibility for the successful execution of each assigned project for schedule compliance, budget compliance, and scope and quality of deliverables. Build relationships and coordinate with the client and project personnel. Ensure the client's input and job requirements are adequately addressed and implemented consistently within the contractual requirements. Organize and supervise the implementation of project management systems and corporate quality systems.

Maintain a documentation file, accurately describing all commercial, technical and financial correspondence. Prepare and evaluate monthly progress reports; describing the schedule, manpower expenditures and work scope for accuracy, completeness and timeliness. Ensure invoices are processed timely and accurately. Act as a liaison between the client and the accounting department on outstanding invoices over 90 days old.

Identify and document that engineering change orders are being processed in a timely fashion where additional work is identified beyond original scope. Develop new business opportunities as a by-product of relationship with clients. Participate in business development meetings. Plan and identify upcoming tasks, potential problem areas, technical information, staffing priorities and identify solutions where necessary.

Responsible to maintain proper staff levels to meet project requirements. Actively recruit and train personnel for project as necessary. Develop, coach and track employee skill level in technical and work management areas. Develops project proposals, proposal scopes of work, and budgets.

Develop and present Project Reports for clients. Principal client contact for major accounts and manage multiple customers simultaneously. Performs field walk downs and data collection. Salary will be commensurate with experience. System One maintains a drug-free workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Kern Oil & Refining Co. is an independent, family-owned, and operated refinery producing what we call “California Clean” transportation fuels. Tucked into a rural corner of Kern County, Kern Oil & Refining Co. has been operating continuously in the Central Valley since 1934.

Role Summary:
The Application Engineer sees it all—design, manufacturing, installation and operation of our pumps and seals at our customers’ sites in the oil and chemical industries. The AE is actively engaged in troubleshooting problems and implementing solutions onsite at nearby customer facilities.

Summary of Position:
The Project Engineer is responsible for designing and managing mechanical engineering projects from conception to completion. He/she will apply his/her experience in: HVAC, plumbing/piping and fire protection systems. As part of a multi-disciplined firm, he/she will be coordinating with Site/Civil Engineers, Electrical Engineers, Structural Engineers, Architects and Construction Project Managers. He/she will be responsible for the production of mechanical engineering construction documents while adhering to client requirements, code requirements and site adjustments.
Essential Duties:
Conduct site visit investigations and generate reports and recommendations based on findings.

Our Energy group in the Environment & Infrastructure Business Unit specializes in providing innovative approaches to solving difficult problems in the areas of oil and gas exploration and production and using or storing carbon dioxide generated during energy production and use. Pipe Stress Engineer Maryland Heights, MO System One is seeking a Pipe Stress Engineer will be responsible for performing pipe stress analysis per applicable ASME codes and standards; utilize pipe stress software; evaluate calculated stress results, displacements, and pipe support loads; and design and select supports, spring hangers, flexible hose, and expansion joints for piping systems as well as preparation of technical datasheets. Pipe Stress Engineer Responsibilities: Responsible for completing project specific objectives on time Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, schematics, or computer-generated reports Provide direct support to staff engineers in planning, design, analysis, manufacturing, and assembly in a hands-on capacity Conduct and participate in design reviews and various engineering related meetings Develop, execute, and document test procedures and results Gather, analyze, and document data concerning existing equipment and provide data comparisons Develop 3D models for rapid prototyping Complete project documentation as required by the engineering quality management process Assist with the development of the equipment analytics scheme Conduct research that tests or analyzes the feasibility, design, operation, or performance of equipment, components, or systems Develop and test models of alternate designs and processing methods to assess feasibility, operating condition effects, possible new applications and necessity of modification Specify system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications Develop, coordinate, or monitor all aspects of production, including selection of manufacturing methods, fabrication, or operation of product designs Independently evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria using judgment in making minor adaptations and modifications Present technical information to peers or other personnel for review, to implement operating procedures, and resolve system malfunctions Recommend design modifications to eliminate machine or system malfunctions Pipe Stress Engineer Requirements: Bachelors Degree in a mechanical, industrial, chemical or petroleum engineering discipline from an accredited engineering program 6-8 years of background in one or more of the following industries: Energy and Chemicals, Power, Food and Beverage, Pharma and Biotech, Manufacturing 6-8 years of experience with pipe stress analysis, CAESAR II, NozzlePro, manual valve list, stress list, line list, specialty items list, requisition development Pipe stress analysis experience with Hot and Cold (Cryo) lines, etc Knowledge of ASME B31.3 code, API codes All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. Salary will be commensurate with experience. System One maintains a drug-free workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Build relationships and coordinate with the client and project personnel. Organize and supervise the implementation of project management systems and corporate quality systems.

Maintain a documentation file, accurately describing all commercial, technical and financial correspondence. Identify and document that engineering change orders are being processed in a timely fashion where additional work is identified beyond original scope. Develop new business opportunities as a by-product of relationship with clients. Participate in business development meetings. Plan and identify upcoming tasks, potential problem areas, technical information, staffing priorities and identify solutions where necessary.

Responsible to maintain proper staff levels to meet project requirements. Actively recruit and train personnel for project as necessary. Develop, coach and track employee skill level in technical and work management areas. Develops project proposals, proposal scopes of work, and budgets.

Develop and present Project Reports for clients. Principal client contact for major accounts and manage multiple customers simultaneously. Performs field walk downs and data collection. Introduction
Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a CTP you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities
Technical Sales Specialist for the Industrial Market to team with IBM System z software to support the 5 industries of the market (Automotive, Chemicals and Petroleum, Electronics, Aerospace, and Industrial Products). In addition to a technical foundation, the Technical Sales Specialist will require excellent consultative, project management and solution sales skills to foster relationships with clients, IBM Partners, resident and cross-functional peers in order to execute sales objectives and targets.

Company:
Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is an independent oil and natural gas company headquartered in downtown Houston, TX. In partnership with a leading private equity financial sponsor, Carnelian Energy Capital, Percussion pursues an acquisition and exploitation strategy in select onshore basins in North America with existing operations in in the Delaware Basin.Percussion Petroleum I, LLC was formed in January 2016 with an equity commitment from Carnelian Energy Capital’s first fund. Percussion built a 22,000 net acre position in Eddy & Lea County, New Mexico with 220 operated wells that produced 9000 net boepd, which was sold in June 2019.

You will coordinate and share opinions with a control center in Bogota and other regional centers that will be established as we continue to roll out. Travel will be in the US and to other countries.

Introduction
Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a CTP you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities
Technical Sales Specialist for the Industrial Market to team with IBM System z software to support the 5 industries of the market (Automotive, Chemicals and Petroleum, Electronics, Aerospace, and Industrial Products). The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in System z software, demonstrating a high level of expertise in IBM System z. In addition to a technical foundation, the Technical Sales Specialist will require excellent consultative, project management and solution sales skills to foster relationships with clients, IBM Partners, resident and cross-functional peers in order to execute sales objectives and targets.

Location Preference: Any where in US

Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is searching for a contract Reservoir Engineer for operated assets in the Delaware Basin; this position will report directly to the VP of Engineering.
Company:
Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is an independent oil and natural gas company headquartered in downtown Houston, TX. In partnership with a leading private equity financial sponsor, Carnelian Energy Capital, Percussion pursues an acquisition and exploitation strategy in select onshore basins in North America with existing operations in in the Delaware Basin.Percussion Petroleum I, LLC was formed in January 2016 with an equity commitment from Carnelian Energy Capital’s first fund. Percussion built a 22,000 net acre position in Eddy & Lea County, New Mexico with 220 operated wells that produced 9000 net boepd, which was sold in June 2019.

Introduction
Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a CTP you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities
Technical Sales Specialist for the Industrial Market to team with IBM System z software to support the 5 industries of the market (Automotive, Chemicals and Petroleum, Electronics, Aerospace, and Industrial Products). The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in System z software, demonstrating a high level of expertise in IBM System z. In addition to a technical foundation, the Technical Sales Specialist will require excellent consultative, project management and solution sales skills to foster relationships with clients, IBM Partners, resident and cross-functional peers in order to execute sales objectives and targets.

Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is an independent oil and natural gas company headquartered in downtown Houston, TX. In partnership with a leading private equity financial sponsor, Carnelian Energy Capital, Percussion pursues an acquisition and exploitation strategy in select onshore basins in North America with existing operations in in the Delaware Basin.Percussion Petroleum I, LLC was formed in January 2016 with an equity commitment from Carnelian Energy Capital’s first fund. meetings Develop, execute, and document test procedures and results Gather, analyze, and document data concerning existing equipment and provide data comparisons Develop 3D models for rapid prototyping Complete project documentation as required by the engineering quality management process Assist with the development of the equipment analytics scheme Conduct research that tests or analyzes the feasibility, design, operation, or performance of equipment, components, or systems Develop and test models of alternate designs and processing methods to assess feasibility, operating condition effects, possible new applications and necessity of modification Specify system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications Develop, coordinate, or monitor all aspects of production, including selection of manufacturing methods, fabrication, or operation of product designs Independently evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria using judgment in making minor adaptations and modifications Present technical information to peers or other personnel for review, to implement operating procedures, and resolve system malfunctions Recommend design modifications to eliminate machine or system malfunctions Pipe Stress Engineer Requirements: Bachelors Degree in a mechanical, industrial, chemical or petroleum engineering discipline from an accredited engineering program 6-8 years of background in one or more of the following industries: Energy and Chemicals, Power, Food and Beverage, Pharma and Biotech, Manufacturing 6-8 years of experience with pipe stress analysis, CAESAR II, NozzlePro, manual valve list, stress list, line list, specialty items list, requisition development Pipe stress analysis experience with Hot and Cold (Cryo) lines, etc Knowledge of ASME B31.3 code, API codes All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply. Job Title: Technical Pre-Sales Engineer - IBM System Z
Job Description:
Introduction
Client Technical Specialists (CTP) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a CTP you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities
Technical Sales Specialist for the Industrial Market to team with IBM System z software to support the 5 industries of the market (Automotive, Chemicals and Petroleum, Electronics, Aerospace, and Industrial Products). The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in System z software, demonstrating a high level of expertise in IBM System z. In addition to a technical foundation, the Technical Sales Specialist will require excellent consultative, project management and solution sales skills to foster relationships with clients, IBM Partners, resident and cross-functional peers in order to execute sales objectives and targets.

Location Preference: Any where in US

Summary:
Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is searching for a contract Reservoir Engineer for operated assets in the Delaware Basin; this position will report directly to the VP of Engineering.
Company:
Percussion Petroleum II, LLC is an independent oil and natural gas company headquartered in downtown Houston, TX. In partnership with a leading private equity financial sponsor, Carnelian Energy Capital, Percussion pursues an acquisition and exploitation strategy in select onshore basins in North America with existing operations in in the Delaware Basin.Percussion Petroleum I, LLC was formed in January 2016 with an equity commitment from Carnelian Energy Capital’s first fund. Percussion built a 22,000 net acre position in Eddy & Lea County, New Mexico with 220 operated wells that produced 9000 net boepd, which was sold in June 2019.

Description
Who are we? Watch to find out! Do you have a long-term vision for your career? Is it time that you join a company that aligns with your values and beliefs? At Flint Hills, 90% of our earnings are reinvested in the company so that we can create opportunities and long-term value for our customers, employees, and society. Our culture is defined by the Market-Based Management (MBM)® philosophy which guides everyday decision making and provides employees with opportunities to contribute and personally benefit from the value they create. 9/80 Schedule
What You Will Do In Your Role

We are offering a job opportunity in Midland area to help build a high growth new oil field service company that employs a proprietary digital technology. Our technology greatly increases secondary and tertiary oil production from existing wells. The salary is competitive, with unlimited career advancement potential.
The Company: Oleum Technology has offices in New York and Houston, and field operations in Colombia and Mexico. We are now expanding our operations into the US and other parts of the world. We also are adding related technologies.
The Position: You will be trained in our technology and be part of a crack global team of well and reservoir experts. You will be involved in picking appropriate wells, overseeing tests, conducting equipment installation, monitoring production from a control center in Houston, working remotely with operators, and traveling on immediate notice to solve major issues if necessary. You will take the initiative to maintain good relations at the operations and management level with clients. You will coordinate and share opinions with a control center in Bogota and other regional centers that will be established as we continue to roll out. Travel will be in the US and to other countries.

If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you’re searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. Here, your opportunity for professional development and industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!

The AE is actively engaged in troubleshooting problems and implementing solutions onsite at nearby customer facilities.

Essential Duties:
Conduct site visit investigations and generate reports and recommendations based on findings.

They are looking for a Mechanical Integrity Engineer who has fixed equipment experience to support their refinery in the South Bay.
Summary:

The Mechanical Integrity Engineer helps ensure reliable mechanical integrity of fixed equipment and piping with the prevention of leaks, failures, and process safety events. Activities include monitoring and responding to refinery operational conditions, implementing and supporting Mechanical Integrity Department initiatives, and providing technical input for Maintenance and Project Engineering objectives.

Our Energy group in the Environment & Infrastructure Business Unit specializes in providing innovative approaches to solving difficult problems in the areas of oil and gas exploration and production and using or storing carbon dioxide generated during energy production and use. We use advanced earth science tools, methods, and models to characterize geologic systems for the oil and gas industry and for long term storage of CO2, including enhanced hydrocarbon recovery. Our clients include large and small oil and gas companies, engineering companies, electric utilities, and federal and state governments.
